title: Iambadoule
extract:
Iambadoule is the only epigraphically testified goddess, together with her consort the Thracian god Sbelsurd. Iambadoule is equivalent to the demigoddess Iambe, first mentioned by Homer.

The inscription in ancient greek:

θεῷ Ζβερθούρδῳ καὶ Ἰαμβαδούλῃ ἐπιφανηστάτοις Αὐρ(ήλιος) Διονύσιος, στρατ(ιώτης) χῶρτις τοῦ πραιτ(ωρίου) ἑκατοντάρχ(ου) Φλωρεντίνου, θέλων ἀνέθηκα


Translation:

To God Zberthourdos (Sbelsurd) and Iambaldoule the eminent Aurelius Dionysius, a local soldier of the pretorian centurion Florentine, wished to dedicate (this plate).
